body_html:
OK, I think this problem might be due to Keras creating its own session, based on this line in the stack trace:

      File "..../keras-1.2.2-1/lib/python2.7/site-packages/keras/backend/tensorflow_backend.py", line 1834, in batch_get_value
        return get_session().run(xs)

I'm not particularly familiar with Keras, but I think there's a K.set_session() method to which you can pass your own sess, and if you do that the error should be resolved.

body:
OK, I think this problem might be due to Keras creating its own session, based on this line in the stack trace:

```
      File "..../keras-1.2.2-1/lib/python2.7/site-packages/keras/backend/tensorflow_backend.py", line 1834, in batch_get_value
        return get_session().run(xs)
```

I'm not particularly familiar with Keras, but I think there's [a `K.set_session()` method](https://github.com/fchollet/keras/blob/4fa7e5d454dd4f3f33f1d756a2a8659f2e789141/keras/backend/tensorflow_backend.py#L129) to which you can pass your own `sess`, and if you do that the error should be resolved.
